database

Class Nexus

  • java.lang.Object
    • database.Nexus

  • public class Nexus
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is essentially the outermost part of the 'Datastoragemanagement' part of the system. This class handles all connections to the database and takes in requests primarily from the 'Controlling/Model' part of the program. In terms of a traditional VMC pattern, one might view this as part of the Model. As of now, this class also throws all exceptions to the controller class for it to handle there. In this way, this class won't be responsible for describing the errors as they should be displayed in the interface.
    Author:
    Magnus Stahl

    • Method Detail

      • closeDatabase

        public void closeDatabase()
        Closes down the database. Should be used in the GUI for closing connection and in testing.

      • createEntryReservation

        public Reservation createEntryReservation(Reservation r)
                                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creator method for reservations. Receives an incomplete (missing ID) reservation object and inserts it in the database with an autogenerated ID.
        Parameters:
        r - A valid reservation with or without id, won't matter.
        Returns:
        Reservation The same reservation but with a database-generated ID.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • createEntryCustomer

        public Customer createEntryCustomer(Customer c)
                             throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method sends a request to a database to create a post in a specific table using the Customer object from the parameter. If the query is successful, the method will return a new Customer object with the same information as the previous but with a unique id generated in the database.
        Parameters:
        c - Any valid customer object.
        Returns:
        Customer A new object alike the previous, except with a new ID.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

        public VehicleType createEntryVehicleType(VehicleType vt)
                                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method sends a request to a database to create a post in a specific table using the VehicleType object from the parameter. If the query is successful, the method will return a new VehicleType object with the same information as the previous but with a unique id generated in the database.
        Parameters:
        vt - Any valid VehicleType object.
        Returns:

      • deleteCustomer

        public boolean deleteCustomer(Customer c)
                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method requests the database connected to this class that it deletes a post in a table with information corresponding EXACTLY to the object passed in the parameter.
        Parameters:
        c - A customer object with information corresponding to a post in the database
        Returns:
        boolean true if the request was successful, false if the request failed.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getVehicles

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Vehicle> getVehicles()
                                                         throws java.sql.SQLException
        The following methods returns HashMaps containing the different types of objects used in the Controller for modifying, searching and sorting. These methods should be called at the loading of the program and ONLY there, as they do not guarantee consistency of data if the database itself has been changed. Also the methods involves quite a bit of queries from the database but for now this seems like an okay method. author msta & tbrj
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
